message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of synthesizing photo-realistic images of people in arbitrary poses using generative adversarial learning. The paper proposes a novel approach for this task that is fully unsupervised. The paper uses a pose conditioned bidirectional generator and a novel loss function that incorporates content and style terms to produce images of high perceptual quality. Given the focus on image synthesis and deep learning, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also deals with graphics and rendering, which makes cs.GR (Computer Graphics) a likely sub-category as well. The use of generative adversarial learning and loss functions suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the use of the DeepFashion dataset suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.MM (Multimedia).
